snippet: Monks tied to a wave of self-burnings are said to have been radicalized by a Chinese crackdown on a monastery that has amounted to one of the harshest in Tibet.
abstract: Monks at the Kirti Monastery in Sichuan Province have been at the center of one of the biggest waves of self-immolations in modern history; some claim that Kirti has been radicalized in the last four years by an occupation of the monastery that amounted to one of the harshest crackdowns in Tibet; Chinese security measures have converted the monastery into a de facto prison, which has fueled the anger that the measures are aimed at containing.

byline.contributor: Zhang Wei contributed research from Beijing.

lead_paragraph: Monks tied to a wave of self-burnings are said to have been radicalized by a Chinese crackdown on a monastery that has amounted to one of the harshest in Tibet.

headline.seo: Wave of Tibet Self-Immolations Challenges Chinese Rule
headline.main: In Occupied Tibetan Monastery, a Reason for Fiery Deaths
headline.print_headline: From the Tibetan Monastery at the Heart of Self-Immolations, an Explanation
